name: Duet Style 2-in-1 Hot Air Styler
categories: Hair, Tools, Hair Straighteners & Flat Irons
about: What it is: A 2-in-1 hot-air styler that transforms hair from wet to styled for smooth hair with no damage.*..Hair Type: Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily..Hair Texture: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Concerns:.- Frizz.- Shine.- Straightening and Smoothing..Key Benefits:.- Dry and style at the same time with no damage.- Unprecedented softness for up to 48 hours**.- Protects hair’s natural moisture..What Else You Need to Know: Transform hair from wet to styled without compromising hair health. Duet Style respects your hair's natural moisture*** and dries with no damage,* sizzling, or burning smell. Once hair is dry, turn on Shine Shot™ mode to straighten your hair at the optimal temperature of 365°F. For all hair types..*No thermal hair damage detected after 4 passes in wet to style mode vs naturally dried hair..**Consumer testing, 142 women, June 2021..***vs. naturally dried hair, dependent on consumer use..Research Results:.- No hair damage*.- Up to 48 hours of unprecedented softness**.- 2x more shine***.- Protects hair's natural moisture***.*No thermal hair damage detected after 4 passes in wet to style mode vs naturally dried hair.**Consumer testing, 142 women, June 2021.***vs naturally dried hair, dependent on consumer use..
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Remove excess water and ensure your hair is towel dried before use..-Slide the power button upwards to turn ON your Duet Style. After a few seconds you will hear the fan ramp up as it heats up to the optimal low styling temperature for wet hair. Once the light stops flashing and the product beeps, it is ready to use..-Divide your hair into 2-inch manageable sections, no larger than the width of the plates. .-Take a section of hair and place Duet Style close to the roots, pausing for three seconds. .-Glide down the hair toward the ends in a slow and steady pace. Repeat until dry and move on to the next section of hair, starting once again from the roots..-Once all your hair is completely dried, for an optional boost of shine, activate Shine Shot™ by pressing down the Shine Shot™ button for 4 seconds until you hear a beep (Shine Shot™ should only be used on dry hair.) The fan will stop and the plate temperature will increase to the optimal ghd styling temperature of 365°F. Once the product beeps and the lights stop flashing, Shine Shot™ is ready. Your Duet Style can now be used as a regular flat iron. .-If you wish to return from Shine Shot™ back to wet-to-style mode, press and hold the Shine Shot™ button for 2 seconds. Your tool will beep as the plates cool down and the fan will start. The ‘ready to use’ tone will play when it is safe to use on wet hair.

reviews.review_title: Not a time saver, but otherwise great
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: My hair is fine, dry, colour-treated, and naturally curly with an inconsistent curl pattern, so I find it easiest to straighten my hair after washing it. I was interested in this styler from the time it was launched, and once it was on sale, I decided to splurge. The first time I used it, I followed the instructions carefully and held it at the roots for a couple of seconds before drying the length of my hair. This lead to lumps and bumps near my roots which were hard to get rid of. Now I go back over the hair closest to my roots 3-4 times instead and don't have those bumps.   I would agree that there is minimal damage from this tool. After drying my hair, I only go over the top layer with the shine shot, so the rest of my hair isn't exposed to more heat than it takes to dry it. And my hair stays straight until my next wash, although I haven't been exposed to much humidity since I bought this. So far, minimal touching up is needed between washes.   This tool doesn't dry my hair faster, however. Previously I used a hair dryer with a round brush and then a straightener. Between drying smaller sections of hair at a time and having to focus more on the roots, I would say that this tool takes the same amount of time or a bit more to go from wet to styled.   I took off one star because even on sale, this hair tool is very expensive.

I do have to use the curling iron to touch up my roots at my part because this thicker design is hard to get close to the scalp. I don’t mind that though because the thick design means I can get through big sections at a time. I have been pairing it with the bumble and bumble hairdressers invisible oil primer and the ghd sleek talker for protection and shine and this duo seems to work great with the duet for a smooth, shiny, and protected look! Highly recommend!

I was so impressed the first time I used it as just a straightener. I was used to turning on my other straighteners and having to do something else while it heated up, but not the Duet Style.  Overall, the GHD Duet Style is a wonderful product. It dries and straightens my hair in around 5 minutes, while not damaging it like other products have. No sizzling or steam coming from my hair or the machine. My hair always comes out soft and straight. I would absolutely recommend this product!

reviews.review_text: The GHD Duet Style 2-in-1 Hot Air Styler is a must have for anyone who is looking for smooth, frizz-free straight hair MINUS the heat damage! I have been using this product about two times a week for a month now to really test it out, and all in all I have to say that I could not be happier. I have long naturally wavy/frizzy hair but with this product I am able to achieve a beautiful just-out-the-salon look at home as it leaves my hair soft, smooth, and UNBELIEVABLY shiny! The only fault I could find is that the styler is a little bulky which is expected but it  does work wonders and is still very user-friendly and easy to use. It also comes with a small instruction leaflet which tells you how to use the tool step by step. I have found that in order to achieve the best results I start with wet, towel-dried hair and prep my hair with heat protectant as well as other before-styling serums. I divide and clip my hair up and take approximately 2 inch sections, one at a time, and hold the styler starting from my roots. After giving it a few seconds, I proceeded by moving the styler down the rest of the hair shaft. I repeat that motion until I feel that my hair is completely dry which usually takes me about 2-3 runs per section. I find that after doing this, I can already see a noticeable difference in the sheen of my hair, but using the shine shot option really adds that extra WOW factor! You wait for the plates to heat and roughly run your hair through the styler once again. The shine shot option more or less acts like a regular hair straightener over the previous hair dryer mode which really works to smoothen out any remaining kinks or imperfections. My whole process from wet to dry hair takes me about 35-40 minutes. Moreover, I feel guilt-free about using this innovative tool to style my hair as it doesn’t cause nearly as much heat damage as conventional hair straighteners. I 100% recommend this product and would rate this styler a 9.5/10. My hair feels AMAZING!

reviews.review_text: Ok, I will start off by saying I currently own two other GHD tools and they are fantastic. I had hoped this product would be a great addition when I am short on time. Sadly, it did not live up to my expectations. The unit is sleek and feels of high quality. It is very large in size, close in length and width of the Revlon One Step but much heavier. It has the quality of other GHD products. The product works twofold, first as a hair dryer with hot air coming from the middle of the plates, then a shine shot step for shine, which is similar to a hair straightener (plates). But it is a time consuming product. I have wavy, medium thick, long, bleached, and dyed hair. I followed the instructions, going section by section. Unless your hair is very lightly damp, it will take awhile to fully dry the hair prior to using the shine shot / straighter part/hot metal plates. You will also have to section the hair first, dry all sections/full head of hair first prior to completing shine shot step, for which you will need to resection. While the concept and brand is good, this product may be more suited for those with thiner, shorter, easier to style hair. This product was a miss for me, and it's less time consuming and easier on the wrists to dry using my Dyson and using a straightener curler after. 3/5 mostly for the quality of the product, but 2/5 for performance.

My hair is very wavy and ghd Duet 2-in-1 styler helped by making it shiny and straight after using it.  How did I use it? After a shower a dried my hair with the drier setting, which is the default setting, this setting is efficient and it actually dried my hair and also my hair was untangled after this. After drying I thought it my hair looked already nice. I can use my hair that way too...  I proceeded to turn on the flat iron setting and wow my hair was straight and shiny really quickly. I love this hair tool because it does what it promises and from now on it is my to go drier/flat iron hair tool. This is exactly what I was looking for. This Duet is good looking and easy to use. Since I like to travel this will save me luggage space which is very important for travelers. Love this white version!

reviews.review_text: I’ve had the chance to use this product a little over a month and absolutely amazed. I was a little weary due to previous products claiming to do the same thing you hear the sizzle or damaged hair. Absolutely not the case and I have thick/long hair. reviews.review_text: This is a really nice hair dryer/flat iron in one. I think it would be best for someone with thick hair who straightens their hair often. I received this device from Influenster in exchange for my review, but I have naturally straight hair, so while it is nice for drying my hair, the flat iron part for me is somewhat unnecessary. I have to go over sections of my hair a few times to get them dry enough to use the flat iron setting, but when I do it leaves my hair very shiny. I lent it to my mom to use and while she liked it, she found it a little heavy and difficult to use on the back of her head. I find that I can’t get as much volume at the root as I could with a round brush and a hair dryer. I think this product is great, but definitely works best for someone who frequently straightens their hair and wants the convenience of a two-in-one product.

reviews.review_title: The tool I didn’t know I needed
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product as a free sample from Influenster and GHD in exchange for my honest feedback.  Initially I was nervous to get this to try. It looks like a bulky tool and I was thinking that it was a straightener for wet hair and worried that it would burn my hair. I completely misunderstood what the product was. It’s literally a hair dryer and straightener in one. Be sure to follow the product instructions. I used my amika wizard spray protectant on towel dried hair. I divided my hair into four total sections and it works best if you don’t use too big of a piece of hair to work with. No bigger than the size of the straightening plate. This dries hair so well, and relatively quickly. From towel dried hair and after drying I went over with the shine shot. The whole thing took about 22 minutes. Saves a ton of time. It makes your hair soft and does something a regular straightener doesn’t do for me and gave me some root volume. I noticed that with this tool if I put my hair up that mysteriously my rubber bands don’t leave crazy lines in my hair. This is now my very favorite thing. I really don’t know how I ever lived without this before. I recommend to everyone to have this product and if anything ever happens to this one I will be repurchasing it.
